relevant_findings.general_condition: appeared generally well but somewhat uncomfortable
relevant_findings.heart_exam: regular rate and rhythm without murmurs, rubs, or gallops
relevant_findings.lung_exam: clear breath sounds bilaterally, no respiratory distress
relevant_findings.abdominal_exam: normal bowel sounds; no tenderness, guarding, or rebound; no organomegaly

relevant_findings.cardiac_exam: normal coronary arteries on cardiac catheterization
relevant_findings.ECG: demonstrated partial resolution of ST-segment elevations

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure decreased from 155/97 mm Hg to 102/48 mm Hg and ST-segment elevations showed partial resolution

relevant_findings.MRI_findings: subendocardial resting perfusion defect and a small region of delayed hypoenhancement along the inferior wall, indicative of myocardial infarction

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: denied any further episodes of chest pain, shortness of breath, or exercise limitation
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms resolved since the initiation of treatment; no episodes of chest pain recorded
